abstract.p: New coalition is gathering signatures in Southampton and East Hampton, Long Island, for referendum seeking to block development of 4,500 acres in state-designated special ground-water protection area (S)

block.p: A new coalition is gathering signatures in Southampton and East Hampton for a referendum to block development on 4,500 acres in a state-designated special ground-water protection area. The drive comes three months after town officials rejected an extension of the Long Island Pine Barrens Preserve for the same area. The extension was also opposed by landowners and builders.
The referendum would ask voters to develop a plan halting subdivisions and the issuance of construction permits on the watershed lands until they could be purchased by the towns at market value.

A new coalition is gathering signatures in Southampton and East Hampton for a referendum to block development on 4,500 acres in a state-designated special ground-water protection area. The drive comes three months after town officials rejected an extension of the Long Island Pine Barrens Preserve for the same area. The extension was also opposed by landowners and builders.
The referendum would ask voters to develop a plan halting subdivisions and the issuance of construction permits on the watershed lands until they could be purchased by the towns at market value.
The protection area includes 3,000 acres in a northern section of Southampton and 1,500 acres in East Hampton.
